instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00430: What is 820-00430? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00034: What is 820-00034? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only first led on
threads.message:
[FONT=arial]hi, please helpme this motherboard when plug the power  cable fisrt led its power on but [/FONT]  
 [FONT=arial]When I press the power button the second LED turns on for a second and goes out  [/FONT][FONT=arial]* audio codec was shorted and reheat I replace but no lucky any suggestion  [/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only first led on
threads.message:
No schematic available.
I suppose <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> could be close enough.

If LE0302 flashes, means <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> comes on in that moment.
Then all S3 and some S0 voltages should pulse too.
Maybe not the CPU ones.
Check for pulse at all big coils.

Do you get high pulse (20V aprox) at <SIGNAL>FET_EN_P12V_S0</SIGNAL>?
Also check if <SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_FET</SIGNAL> rises to 12V.

Be sure no short on any power rail; especially on page 63.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only first led on
threads.message:
when press power buttons volts appears for 1 second

<SIGNAL>FET_EN_P12V_S0</SIGNAL> = 22V
<SIGNAL>PP12V_S0_FET</SIGNAL>= 12v

big coils

L7650 .  5V
L7120 .   1.8V
L7110 .   1.8V
L7310 .   1.2V
L6901 .  3.42V
L2920 .   1,02V

<CHIP>U8400</CHIP> pads 10 and 12 when press power buttons show 5,1v 

have schematics voltages
<CHIP>U8420</CHIP>
<CHIP>U8440</CHIP>
<CHIP>U8450</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only first led on
threads.message:
What about L7350, L7410, <CHIP>U7490</CHIP>?
<CHIP>U8400</CHIP> outputs are 8 & 13.

Check for short on audio power rails.
You can try new BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only first led on
threads.message:
L7350 . 1,8v
L7410 .  1,05v
<CHIP>U7490</CHIP>  all pads same as schematic
<CHIP>U8400</CHIP> outputs 3.3v

audio ic replace bacause shorted and reheat

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00430</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only first led on
threads.message: Check if all voltageas try to appear on audio area.
